concise_definition: v. 削除, 删去; n. 消费税

definitions.explanation_en: To remove or cut out something, especially something considered undesirable, harmful, or unnecessary, often by deliberate and forceful action.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指有意识地、果断地将某物（尤指被认为不良、有害或不必要的部分）切除或删除。
definitions.example_en: The editor excised several controversial paragraphs from the article before publication.
definitions.example_cn: 编辑在发表前删去了文章中几段有争议的段落。

definitions.explanation_en: To impose or collect an excise tax on goods, especially domestically produced items such as alcohol, tobacco, or fuel.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指对特定商品（如酒精、烟草或燃料）征收消费税。
definitions.example_en: The government plans to excise higher taxes on sugary drinks to combat obesity.
definitions.example_cn: 政府计划对含糖饮料征收更高的消费税，以应对肥胖问题。

definitions.explanation_en: A tax levied on the production, sale, or consumption of specific goods within a country, typically on items like alcohol, tobacco, gasoline, or gambling.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指对国内生产、销售或消费的特定商品所征收的税，通常针对酒精、烟草、汽油或赌博等商品。
definitions.example_en: The excise on cigarettes has increased by 15% this year.
definitions.example_cn: 今年香烟的消费税提高了15%。

comparison.analysis: “Delete” (删除) 是一个通用词，常用于数字或文字内容的移除，语气中性，不强调动机或后果。而 “excise” 更具正式性和目的性，常暗示被移除的部分是不受欢迎或有害的，带有裁剪、净化的意味，多用于书面语或政策语境。
“Tax” (税收) 是总称，涵盖所有类型的政府征税，如所得税、增值税等。而 “excise” 是一种特定类型的税，专指对特定商品在生产或销售环节征收的间接税，范围更窄、更专业。
“Remove” (移除) 是最宽泛的动词，可指物理或抽象的移除，无情感或意图色彩。而 “excise” 隐含一种主动的、有选择性的切除行为，常用于医学、编辑或财政语境，带有更强的规范性和技术性。
